strategy: debug: You are an ML research agent fixing bugs in a solution.

actions.action:
cat << 'ENDOFFILE' > train_and_predict.py
import pandas as pd
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
from sklearn.preprocessing import StandardScaler, OneHotEncoder
from sklearn.compose import ColumnTransformer
from sklearn.pipeline import Pipeline
from sklearn.metrics import r2_score

# Load data
train_df = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test_df = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Separate target variable
X_train = train_df.drop(columns=['SalePrice'])
y_train = train_df['SalePrice']
X_test = test_df.drop(columns=['Id'])

# Handle missing values
X_train.fillna(X_train.mean(), inplace=True)
X_test.fillna(X_train.mean(), inplace=True)

# Categorical columns
categorical_cols = X_train.select_dtypes(include=['object']).columns.tolist()

# Numerical columns
numerical_cols = X_train.select_dtypes(include=['int64', 'float64']).columns.tolist()

# Preprocessing steps
preprocessor = ColumnTransformer(
    transformers=[
        ('num', StandardScaler(), numerical_cols),
        ('cat', OneHotEncoder(handle_unknown='ignore'), categorical_cols)
    ])

# Define pipeline
pipeline = Pipeline(steps=[('preprocessor', preprocessor),
                           ('regressor', LinearRegression())])

# Split validation set
X_val, y_val = train_test_split(X_train, y_train, test_size=0.2, random_state=42)

# Fit model
pipeline.fit(X_train, y_train)

# Predictions
y_pred_train = pipeline.predict(X_train)
y_pred_val = pipeline.predict(X_val)
y_pred_test = pipeline.predict(X_test)

# Evaluate R2 scores
print(f"Train R2 Score: {r2_score(y_train, y_pred_train)}")
print(f"Validation R2 Score: {r2_score(y_val, y_pred_val)}")

# Save predictions to submission.csv
submission = pd.DataFrame({'Id': test_df['Id'], 'SalePrice': y_pred_test})
submission.to_csv('submission.csv', index=False)
ENDOFFILE
Please wait while I run the script and validate the results.

from sklearn.preprocessing import StandardScaler, OneHotEncoder
from sklearn.compose import ColumnTransformer
from sklearn.pipeline import Pipeline
from sklearn.linear_model import LinearRegression

test_df = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

y_train = train_df['SalePrice']
X_test = test_df.drop(columns=['Id'])

X_test.fillna(X_train.mean(), inplace=True)

   import pandas as pd
   from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
   from sklearn.linear_model import LinearRegression
   from sklearn.metrics import r2_score

   # Load data
   train_df = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
   test_df = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

   # Separate target variable
   X_train = train_df.drop(columns=['SalePrice'])
   y_train = train_df['SalePrice']
   X_test = test_df.drop(columns=['Id'])

   # Fill missing values with mean
   X_train.fillna(X_train.mean(), inplace=True)
   X_test.fillna(X_train.mean(), inplace=True)

   # Initialize and fit the model
   model = LinearRegression()
   model.fit(X_train, y_train)

   # Make predictions
   y_pred_train = model.predict(X_train)
   y_pred_test = model.predict(X_test)

   # Evaluate R2 scores
   print(f"Train R2 Score: {r2_score(y_train, y_pred_train)}")

   # Save predictions to submission.csv

cat << 'ENDOFFILE' > train_and_predict.py
   import pandas as pd
   from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
   from sklearn.linear_model import LinearRegression
   from sklearn.metrics import r2_score

   # Load data
   train_df = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
   test_df = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

   # Separate target variable
   X_train = train_df.drop(columns=['SalePrice'])
   y_train = train_df['SalePrice']
   X_test = test_df.drop(columns=['Id'])

   # Fill missing values with median (to avoid bias towards mean)
   X_train.fillna(X_train.median(), inplace=True)
   X_test.fillna(X_train.median(), inplace=True)

   # Initialize and fit the model
   model = LinearRegression()
   model.fit(X_train, y_train)

   # Make predictions
   y_pred_train = model.predict(X_train)
   y_pred_test = model.predict(X_test)

   # Evaluate R2 scores
   print(f"Train R2 Score: {r2_score(y_train, y_pred_train)}")

   # Save predictions to submission.csv
   submission = pd.DataFrame({'Id': test_df['Id'], 'SalePrice': y_pred_test})
   submission.to_csv('submission.csv', index=False)
   ENDOFFILE
